title: Mawdryn Undead
dialogue_triumphs: 'I, Mawdryn, have returned. It is time for The Awakening.'
'Oh, I know how many beans make five, Doctor. And you don't have to be a Time Lord to cope with A level Maths.'
goofs: When talking to Turlough in the TARDIS in the fourth episode the Black Guardian appears to spit on himself.

continuity_notes.name: Turlough
continuity_notes.description: A non-Earth character posing as a schoolboy, with supposedly dead parents and a strange solicitor in London.
continuity_notes.current_status: Enters into a pact with the Black Guardian to kill the Doctor.

continuity_notes.name: Black Guardian
continuity_notes.description: A powerful entity last seen in 'The Armageddon Factor'.
continuity_notes.current_status: Returns to make a pact with Turlough.

continuity_notes.name: Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart
continuity_notes.description: Former UNIT commander, now teaching at a public school.
continuity_notes.current_status: Experiences memory loss due to meeting his future self.

continuity_notes.name: Blinovitch Limitation Effect
continuity_notes.description: A time travel phenomenon causing energy explosions when people from different time zones touch.
continuity_notes.current_status: Plays a crucial role in resolving the story's conflict.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine.
continuity_notes.current_status: No longer has a zero room, but its atmosphere helps stabilize Mawdryn.

continuity_notes.name: Mawdryn
continuity_notes.description: An alien scientist trapped in perpetual mutation due to stolen Time Lord technology.
continuity_notes.current_status: Seeking help to end his deathless existence.

technobabble: Could it have been effected by a tangential deviation coming out of the warp ellipse?
Not with the dead reckoning alignment in the coordinates.
The Doctor talks about reversing the polarity of the neutron flow.

locations.name: Mawdryn's ship
locations.description: A spacecraft trapped in a warp ellipse, visiting Earth every 70 years.
locations.current_status: Houses Mawdryn and his fellow mutants.

locations.name: Brendon School
locations.description: A public school where the Brigadier teaches.
locations.current_status: Setting for events in both 1977 and 1983.

untold_adventures: Possible untelevised adventure explaining Tegan's knowledge of transmat dangers.
additional_notes: The story takes place in two time zones simultaneously, which was an idea long overdue in the series.
bottom_line: The links to the past aren't over-done, and a story (briefly) taking place in two time zones was an idea long overdue. It's nice to have an adventure where someone doesn't want to destroy the universe or take over the Earth, although this does mean that the final episode is a bit dull.
